title: Madonna's adopted twins Esther and Stella settle into their new home with family pyjama party
text:
Madonna's adopted twins Esther and Stella settle into their new home with family pyjama party The little girls get a warm welcome from Madonna's children Mercy and David Share Madonna and kids (Photo: Instagram/Getty) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Madonna only adopted her twin girls Esther and Stella earlier this month – but they're already settling into their new home in America. 
The popstar shared a picture of the four-year-old twins wit two of her other children Mercy and David, both aged 11. 
And wearing matching butterfly-print pyjamas, the girls looked happy to be with their older brother and sister. 
"Pyjama game on... the revolution of [love] starts at home!" Madonna commented on the picture shared with her 8.8m followers. Madonna's children pose in their pyjamas (Photo: Instagram) 
Yesterday, the popstar shared another sweet photo of her newly adopted twin girls posing in matching tracksuits. 
Dressed in the black and gold outfits and matching gold headbands, the girls both smiled to camera in the snap. 
“Today’s Blessing brought to you by Adidas!” Madonna wrote alongside it. 
The popstar was granted permission to adopt four-year-old twins Stella and Esther from Malawi earlier this month, and allowed to bring them home with her to the US while the adoption process is finalised. https://www.instagram.com/p/BQyCURZAtgN/?taken-by=madonna&hl=en/embed 
On Saturday night, she posted a sweet video to Instagram showing the girls singing along as Twinkle Twinkle Little Star was played on the piano. 
Madonna, 58, was granted an adoption order by the Malawi High Court on February 7 and told she was free to take the girls back to the US. 
The singer will be under observation by the court for a year before the adoption process is finalised, and a home study must be submitted to authorities. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
